name: df-adjh
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cado, copab(s0, s1, w3a(wf(cv(s0), chba, chba), wf(cv(s1), chba, chba), wral(s2, chba, wral(s3, chba, wceq(co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), csp, cv(s3)), co(cv(s2), csp, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)))))))))
comment: Define the adjoint of a Hilbert space operator (if it exists). The domain of ` adjh ` is the set of all adjoint operators. Definition of adjoint in [Kalmbach2] p. 8. Unlike Kalmbach (and most authors), we do not demand that the operator be linear, but instead show (in ~ adjbdln ) that the adjoint exists for a bounded linear operator. (Contributed by NM, 20-Feb-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
